concept.title: Ephemeral TCP Port Limits
concept.shortdesc: By default, Windowsâ€™ ephemeral ports are within the range 1024-4999, inclusive.You can increase the range.

section.p: If you are repeatedly receiving the following exception:
section.codeblock: java.net.BindException: Address already in use: connect
section.p: and if your system is experiencing a high degree of network activity, such as numerous short-lived client connections, this could be related to a limit on the number of ephemeral TCP ports. While this issue could occur with other operating systems, typically, it is only seen with Windows due to a low default limit.
Perform this procedure to increase the limit:

ol.li: From the Edit menu, click New, and then add the following registry entry: Value Name: MaxUserPort Value Type: DWORD Value data: 36863
Exit the Registry Editor, and then restart the computer.

section.p: This affects all versions of the Windows operating system.

p.b: Note for UDP on Unix Systems

section.p: Unix systems have a default maximum socket buffer size for receiving UDP multicast and unicast transmissions that is lower than the default settings for mcast-recv-buffer-size and udp-recv-buffer-size. To achieve high-volume multicast messaging, you should increase the maximum Unix buffer size to at least one megabyte.
